questions.text: A student went on a trip to Jaisalmer, where the temp was 40 degrees, and relative humidity was 20%. What will the mechanism of heat loss be?
questions.explanation:
Mechanism

Description

Effectiveness in a Hot, Dry Climate

Evaporation

Heat loss through sweat evaporation

Most effective (low humidity allows efficient sweat evaporation)

Radiation

Emission of infrared heat waves to cooler surroundings

Less effective (ambient temp is high, reducing heat gradient)

Conduction

Direct heat transfer through contact with a cooler object

Minimal (air and objects in the desert are also hot)

Convection

Heat transfer via air movement

Limited (unless there is strong wind aiding heat dissipation)

questions.text: Mode of disposal of sewage ground water:
questions.explanation: Correct Option D) All of the abov

questions.text: What is the required thickness of a lead apron used for radiation protection?
questions.explanation:
RADIATION DOSE

BIOLOGICAL EFFECTS

<5 rad
  • No adverse effects

 

5-150 rad
  • Nausea, vomiting
  • Mild haematological changes

 

150-1100 rad
  • Bone marrow failure (anaemia, infections, bleeding tendency - might require bone marrow transplantation)

 

1100-2000 rad
  • Gastrointestinal destruction in addition (death almost always occurs in a few weeks)

>2000 rad
  • Muscle and brain damage (death occurs in days)

questions.text: A 45-year-old healthy man with a history of small streaks of blood in his stools is being sent for a colonoscopy to screen for colon cancer. This type of prevention is-
questions.explanation:
Levels of prevention

Definition

Primordial (Option A ruled out)
  • Prevention of establishment of risk factors.
  • It aims to discourage people from adopting harmful habits.

Primary (Option C ruled out)

 
  • Prevention of onset of disease in a high-risk group/individual.
  • It aims to protect the health of those who are at risk.
  • Reduces the incidence of the disease.

Secondary (Option B)
  • Disease progression can be prevented at an early stage (Disease is reversible).
  • It aims to reduce the prevalence of the disease by early identification and prompt treatment of diseases, and it also prevents complications.

Tertiary (Option D ruled out)
  • Prevention or limitation of impairment and disability in a diseased patient who has developed complications due to the disease and the disease has become irreversible.
  • It aims to minimise a patient's suffering and maximise potential years of useful life.

questions.text: What are the most reliable indicators for regular monitoring of air pollution?

options.label: A
options.text: Sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles

options.label: B
options.text: Sulfur dioxide, lead, and particulate matter

questions.correct_answer: A. Sulfur dioxide, smoke, and suspended particles

questions.text: What is the vector that causes the occurrence of buboes in the community?
questions.explanation:
Disease

Vector

Identification

Habitat

Details

Malaria

Female Anopheles mosquito (Option D ruled out)

 

Slender body, long legs, and dark-colored spots on wings.

Stagnant, clean water sources like ponds, lakes, and rice fields.

Transmits Plasmodium species causing malaria.

Dengue

Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus

Aedes aegypti

White markings on legs, lyre-shaped pattern on the thorax.

Urban areas, especially around human dwellings and discarded containers.

Transmits Dengue virus causing dengue fever.

 

Chikungunya

Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus

Aedes albopictus

Similar to Aedes mosquitoes, with black and white banded legs.

Urban and suburban areas, especially in domestic settings.

Transmits Chikungunya virus, causing joint pain.

Japanese Encephalitis

Culex mosquito

Smaller, brown or black, with a distinct scutellum (plate-like structure).

Ponds, marshes, and areas with stagnant water.

Transmits Japanese encephalitis virus, causing encephalitis.

Leishmaniasis (Kala-azar)

Phlebotomus argentipes (sandfly) (Option B ruled out)

Small, yellowish-brown, with a hairy body and long legs.

Sandy, dusty areas, often near human dwellings or animal shelters.

Transmits Leishmania species causing visceral leishmaniasis.

Bubonic Plague

Xenopsylla cheopis (rat flea)

Small, reddish-brown, flattened body.

Found on rats, especially in urban areas and during rodent infestations.

Transmits Yersinia pestis causing bubonic plague.

Filariasis

Female Culex mosquito

Similar to Anopheles but with more rounded body and darker markings.

Stagnant water, especially in urban and rural areas.

Transmits Wuchereria bancrofti causing lymphatic filariasis.

Zika Virus

Aedes mosquitoes

Aedes albopictus

Similar to Aedes aegypti, black and white striped legs.

Urban and suburban areas, particularly in places with standing water.

Transmits Zika virus causing fever and birth defects.

Tick-borne Encephalitis

Ixodes tick (Option C ruled out)

Small, oval-shaped, with a flattened body.

Forested areas, grasslands, and areas with high animal populations.

Transmits Tick-borne encephalitis virus causing encephalitis.

Rickettsial Diseases

Rhipicephalus (dog tick) and other ticks

Oval, flat, with prominent mouthparts.

Grasslands, forests, and around domesticated animals.

Transmits Rickettsia bacteria causing typhus, scrub typhus, etc.

Malaria (P. falciparum)

Female Anopheles mosquito (Option D ruled out)

 

Same as malaria vector.

Found in areas with stagnant water and human proximity.

Responsible for severe malaria (Plasmodium falciparum).

Scrub Typhus

Leptotrombidium mites (chiggers)

 

Small, red, and often barely visible to the naked eye.

Rural and semi-rural areas with dense vegetation.

Transmits Orientia tsutsugamushi causing scrub typhus.

questions.text: The Pathanamthitta district of Kerala was affected by floods and the government distributed doxycycline tablets for prophylaxis. Which other chemical will be distributed along with it?
questions.explanation:
Chemical

Use

Relevance in Floods

Malathion

Mosquito control (insecticide)

Prevents malaria, dengue

Zinc phosphide

Rodenticide (kills rats)

Not used for mosquitoes

Lindane

Treats lice and scabies

Not relevant for floods

Paris green

Historical mosquito larvicide

Less commonly used today

questions.text: What is the classification of the air quality index in Delhi station on November 23, based on the provided air pollution index chart for 4 consecutive days? Date AQI November 21 350 November 22 340 November 23 407 November 24 356
questions.explanation:
AQI Range

Category

Health Impact

0-50

Good

Minimal impact

51-100

Satisfactory

Minor discomfort to sensitive people

101-200

Moderate

Discomfort to people with respiratory diseases

201-300

Poor

Breathing discomfort for most people

301-400

Very Poor

Respiratory illness on prolonged exposure

401-500

Severe

Severe health impacts, emergency conditions

AQI Range

Category

Health Impact

0-50

Good

Minimal or no impact

51-100

Satisfactory

Minor discomfort for sensitive individuals

101-200

Moderate

Discomfort for people with respiratory diseases

201-300

Poor

Increased discomfort, especially for children, elderly, and those with lung diseases

301-400

Very Poor

Respiratory illnesses on prolonged exposure

401-500

Severe

Serious health impacts, emergency conditions

questions.text: Which type of thermometer is employed to assess the low air velocity rather than the cooling efficiency of the air?
questions.explanation:
Thermometer

Purpose

Measures

Kata thermometer

Low air velocity

Rate of heat loss from a heated bulb

Globe thermometer

Radiant heat

Temperature considering radiation from surroundings

Wet globe thermometer

Thermal comfort index

Combination of air temperature, humidity, and radiant heat

Dial thermometer

General temperature

Direct air or surface temperature

questions.text: What is the standard unit for measuring the brightness of light emitted from a single point source?
questions.explanation:
Photometric Quantity

Definition

SI Unit

Common Usage

Luminous Intensity

Brightness of a light source in a specific direction

Candela (cd)

Used in lighting design, LED specifications

Luminous Flux

Total light emitted in all directions

Lumen (lm) (Option D ruled out)

Used in bulb ratings, projector brightness

Illuminance

Light received per unit area

Lux (lx) (lm/m²) (Option B ruled out)

 

Used in workplace lighting standards, photography

Luminance

Perceived brightness of a surface emitting or reflecting light

Nit (cd/m²) or Lambert (Option C ruled out)

Used in display screens, road signs

Related symptoms

>10mg/L

questions.explanation:
ANOPHELES

CULEX

AEDES

MANSONOIDES

LARVAE
  • No siphon tube
  • Rests parallel to water surface
  • Longer siphon tubes
  • Rests at an angle to water surface
  • Shorter siphon tubes
  • Rests at an angle to water surface

EGGS
  • Lays singly
  • Boat shaped
  • Lateral floats

Lays in clusters (100-250 in a single cluster)
  • Lays singly
  • Cigar shaped
  • Lays in clusters
  • Star-shaped

HABITAT

Exophilic: outside house

Exophilic: day

Endophilic: night

Endophilic: inside house

Exophilic

questions.text: Sickness absenteeism of workers in the industry is used to evaluate
A pus swab has been sent for microbiological examination to your lab. After testing the sample how will you discard it?
questions.explanation:
Color Bin

Waste Type

Example

Disposal Method

Yellow

Infectious waste, human anatomical waste, microbiological waste

Pus swabs, cultures, dressings, placenta

Incineration or deep burial

Red

Contaminated recyclable waste

IV sets, gloves, syringes without needles

Autoclaving/shredding

Blue

Glassware

Broken vials, slides, ampoules

Disinfection & recycling

Black

General non-infectious waste

Office waste, packaging material

Municipal disposal

White (Puncture-proof)

Sharps waste

Needles, scalpels

Autoclaving & shredding

questions.text: Air humidity and dew point temperature of the air is measured using which of the following instruments?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option A - Sling psychrometer

Air humidity measuring instruments

A. Hygrometer

B. Sling psychrometer

  • Wet and dry thermometers are mounted side by side

C. Assman psychrometer

  • Can be used even in strong sunshine

D. Dry and wet bulb hygrometer

  • Most widely used
  • Same readings in both (dry and wet) bulbs indicate 100 per cent saturation with moisture

questions.text: While measuring a patient's blood pressure at a primary health center, the sphygmomanometer accidentally fell and broke, resulting in spilled mercury on the ground. Which of the following is the most appropriate step to clean this spillage?

options.label: A
options.text: Collect it by using a card on a sheet of paper and put the mercury into a jar

options.label: B
options.text: Collect it by sweeping it with a broom and throwing outside

options.label: C
options.text: Collect it by sweeping it and flush it in the toilet

options.label: D
options.text: Collect it by hand and then wash hands with water

questions.correct_answer: A. Collect it by using a card on a sheet of paper and put the mercury into a jar

questions.text: What is the minimum amount of land needed for the trench method to be applied in controlled tipping for a population of 10,000?
Which of the options below does not lead to water hardness?
questions.explanation: Correct Option A: Calcium

questions.text: Mosquito having spotted wings is?
questions.explanation:
Identification

  • Sits at an angle of 450.

  • Head is downwards - resting in an inclined position.

  • Has spotted wings

Breeding
  • Anopheles breed in clean stagnant water (Also called sophisticated mosquitoes).

Eggs
  • Eggs are laid singly.
  • Eggs are boat-shaped with lateral floats.

Larvae
  • Larva doesn't have a siphon tube - no breathing. Rests parallel to the surface of the water.

Flight range
  • 2 to 3 km.
